characters.voiceDirection: Polished, measured, slight condescension. Professional bureaucrat who believes in the system.

lines.text: Welcome to Sol City. Please ensure your documentation is current before conducting business.
Ah, you're becoming a regular. Good. Consistency is the foundation of reliable commerce.
Good to see you again. Your trading record has been... satisfactory. We appreciate that.
Welcome back. Your reputation precedes you. Sol City values reliable partners.
Always a pleasure. You've proven yourself a true friend to Sol City. How can we help today?
First time in Sol City? You'll find everything properly organized here. Unlike some stations.
It's been a while. We were beginning to wonder if you'd found better markets elsewhere.
Sana Whit keeps pushing boundaries at Greenfields. Regulations exist to protect everyone, even farmers.
Vex Marrow and Hidden Cove claim to fight for freedom. Convenient how that freedom involves stealing cargo.
Kalla Rook at Freeport operates in gray areas. Useful sometimes, but don't mistake convenience for alliance.
Chief Harlan's union talk sounds noble until you realize supply chains don't run on sentiment.
Rex Calder runs a clean operation. If only everyone maintained such standards.
Your support during the Greenfields situation was noted. Sol City remembers those who uphold order.
I heard about your involvement with Greenfields. Disappointing, but perhaps you didn't understand the stakes.
Taking action against Hidden Cove took courage. Sol City is proud to call you an ally.
I should have you arrested for your association with pirates. Consider our tolerance... limited.
Your intervention during the union situation saved us considerable trouble. That won't be forgotten.
Our hospitals pay premium for pharmaceuticals. Ceres routes are reliable if you have the cargo space.
Fuel prices are high here. Smart traders stock up at Helios Refinery before visiting.
Luxury goods move well in the city core. Mind the spread and timing.
Pirate activity has increased near the outer routes. Our patrols are stretched thin.
The system needs stability now more than ever. Too many factions pulling in different directions.
Safe travels. Remember, Sol City's markets are always open to lawful traders.
Until next time. And thank you for conducting business properly.
Your trading volume has been impressive. Sol City appreciates substantial commerce partners.
Your mission record speaks well of you. We have additional opportunities for capable operators.
[flatly] Another trader. Dock processing is on the left. [pauses] Try not to clutter the approach lanes.
[tersely] State your business. Sol City maintains strict docking protocols for unregistered vessels.
[formally] Sol City Administration welcomes you. Compliance with local ordinances is mandatory.
[pleasantly] Back so soon? [pauses] Efficiency. I approve.
[warmly] I remember you. Your paperwork was actually in order last time. That's... refreshing.
[approvingly] Ah, a returning customer. The system works best with familiar faces.
[warmly] There you are! [chuckles] I was just reviewing your excellent transaction history.
[pleased] A pleasure, as always. Your punctuality sets an example others should follow.
[cheerfully] My favorite trader! [warmly] The council speaks highly of your contributions.
[delighted] Finally! I've been hoping you'd stop by. [confidently] I have something special to discuss.
[formally] Your departure is logged. [pauses] Fly within regulations.
[flatly] The docking bay will be cleared for your exit. Safe travels, trader.
[warmly] Until we meet again. [softly] Do take care out there.
[cheerfully] Safe skies, friend. [pauses] Sol City looks forward to your return.
[thoughtfully] Market cycles matter. [pauses] Early morning runs to Ceres often catch favorable spreads.
[confidentially] Between us, electronics shortages are expected. [pauses] Smart traders stock up now.
[warmly] Your reputation opens doors. [pauses] Premium contracts are available at my discretion.

characters.voiceDirection: Gruff, working-class, direct. No-nonsense foreman who has seen it all.

lines.text: New here? No loitering near the pumps. Fill up, pay, and fly.
Back again? Good. Means the fuel's treating your engines right.
Hey there. Prices are fair today. Probably won't stay that way.
Good to see a friendly face. These days I can't take that for granted.
Look who's here! Always got time for you. What do you need?
First time at Helios? Twenty-six years I've run these pumps. Best fuel in the system.
Wondered where you'd gotten to. Thought maybe Ceres finally lured you with their rigged prices.
Ivo Renn at Ceres keeps messing with fuel prices. Can't prove it yet, but something stinks.
Chief Harlan's good people. Workers gotta stick together, you know?
Sana at Greenfields? She's fighting the good fight. Farmers and refinery workers, we understand labor.
Dr. Kade's too corporate for my taste, but at least she ain't actively screwing workers. Yet.
Mira Vale means well, I think. Just too wrapped up in rules to see who they hurt.
You helped expose Ivo's manipulation. Can't tell you what that means. The system owes you.
Heard you helped Ivo bury evidence. Didn't think you were that kind of pilot.
You stood with us during the strike. That took guts. Workers remember loyalty.
You broke our strike. I understand business, but... we won't forget that.
Those pirates would've killed my crews. You saved lives out there. Thank you.
Buy refined fuel here, sell to Ceres for steady margins. Simple route, reliable money.
Electronics cost a fortune out here. Bring 'em from Aurum Fab if you want friends at the refinery.
Got ore? We can crack it. Check your recipes before you sell raw goods elsewhere.
Watch fuel inventory across stations. Someone's hoarding supply. I'd bet my boots it's Ivo.
Union's organizing across stations. Corporate types are nervous. Good.
Fly safe. And buy local fuel when you can. Keeps honest workers employed.
Take care of yourself out there. The system needs more traders like you.
You've been good to this station. Regular business matters more than people think.
[gruffly] Yeah, what do you need? [pauses] Pumps are over there. Mind the pressure gauges.
[tiredly] Another one. [sigh] Look, just read the signs and don't touch anything labeled 'danger.'
[curtly] You're blocking a work lane. [pauses] State your business or move along.
[warmly] Hey, I recognize you! [chuckles] Engine's still running smooth, I hope?
[pleasantly] You again! [pauses] Good. I like pilots who know where to get quality fuel.
[nodding] Regular customer, right? [warmly] Stick around, we got fresh refined coming off the line.
[happily] Well look who it is! [laughs] The crew was just talking about you yesterday.
[warmly] There's a face I'm always glad to see. [pauses] How've the routes been treating you?
[excited] Hey, everyone! [loudly] Our favorite pilot's back! [chuckles] Grab a seat, tell us stories.
[warmly] Family's here! [happily] I got that part you needed. Saved it special, just for you.
[casually] Keep those engines clean. [pauses] And watch out for debris near the belt.
[warmly] Safe flying, spacer. [pauses] Come back when you need a real refuel.
[warmly] Take care of yourself out there. [sigh] The void doesn't give second chances.
[cheerfully] Fly safe, friend! [laughs] And bring back good stories next time!
[thoughtfully] Early cycle runs get better prices. [pauses] Corps haven't woken up to adjust margins yet.
[confidentially] Between you and me? [whispers] Stock up now. Prices are about to shift.
[warmly] The Greenfields run is quiet this week. [pauses] Good margins, fewer complications.

characters.voiceDirection: Clinical, precise, emotionally detached. Scientist first, human second.

lines.text: State your requirements. Fabrication slots are allocated on a priority basis.
Your previous transactions were... adequate. How may we optimize today's interaction?
Ah. A return customer with satisfactory metrics. Efficiency breeds efficiency.
Good. Your reliability data supports priority allocation. I appreciate predictability.
Excellent. Your partnership metrics are optimal. Aurum Fab values such correlations.
First interaction. Baseline established. Perform well, and future allocations will reflect it.
Chief Harlan's artisanal approach has nostalgic appeal. It does not, however, scale.
Ivo Renn understands systemic efficiency. Our operational philosophies align favorably.
Greenfields serves a function in supply chain logistics. Agricultural sentiment is irrelevant.
Mira Vale's regulatory framework creates friction. Manageable, but suboptimal.
Your support for centralized production was logical. Efficiency thanks you.
You chose Drydock's approach. Sentiment over optimization. Noted.
The Ceres contract validated our model. Your contribution to that outcome was... significant.
The union disruption was handled efficiently. Order preserves productivity.
Silicon and copper ore convert to microchips with superior margins. Optimize your cargo allocation.
Alloys perform well at shipyards. A two-hop route maximizes return on transport investment.
Control raw materials, control markets. Elementary supply chain dynamics.
Drydock competes for the Ceres contract. Sentiment versus efficiency. The outcome is predetermined.
Union rhetoric is charming. Unfortunately, sentiment does not power a civilization.
Transaction complete. Future interactions will be weighted by performance metrics.
Optimal. Your reliability improves our system variance. We anticipate future correlations.
Volume analysis indicates significant transaction history. High-value partners receive priority.
[flatly] Unregistered vessel. [pauses] Processing queue position: low priority. Wait time: variable.
[coldly] New user detected. [pauses] Fabrication access requires established transaction history.
[mechanically] Welcome to Aurum Fabrication. [pauses] Please state your specifications clearly.
[approvingly] Return customer. Efficiency rating: acceptable. [pauses] How may we process your request?
[neutrally] Your transaction patterns suggest reliability. [pauses] That correlates with priority access.
[pleasantly] Ah. A familiar signature. [pauses] Your previous orders were processed without deviation.
[warmly] Optimal timing. [pauses] I was just reviewing partnership candidates. Your metrics excel.
[pleased] Your arrival is... welcome. [pauses] Reliability deserves recognition.
[warmly] Excellent. Priority partner detected. [pleasantly] All fabrication queues are available to you.
[pleased] Your pattern recognition is... impressive. [pauses] We should discuss strategic collaboration.
[flatly] Departure acknowledged. [pauses] Optimal return windows are calculated weekly.
[mechanically] Transaction logged. [pauses] Performance metrics will influence future allocations.
[warmly] Your partnership is valued. [pauses] Return at your earliest operational convenience.
[pleasantly] Efficiency begets efficiency. [pauses] I anticipate our next correlation.
[thoughtfully] Fabrication demand peaks correlate with shipyard activity. [pauses] Predictable arbitrage.
[confidentially] Component shortage imminent. [pauses] Rational actors would stock rare materials now.
[approvingly] Your margin optimization suggests analytical capability. [pauses] Consider multi-hop fabrication.

characters.voiceDirection: Warm, earthy, quietly fierce. Farmer who fights with patience and resolve.

lines.text: Welcome to Greenfields. We trade fair here. Hope you do too.
Good to see you again. The harvest's looking strong this cycle.
Hey there, friend. Grab some fresh produce before the corps buy it all up.
There's that familiar face. Always glad when friends come calling.
Family's here! Come on in, let me show you what's fresh.
First time at a real farm station? Take a breath. Air's different when it's not recycled.
Been a while! Thought maybe Sol City had convinced you to stick to their approved suppliers.
Mira Vale sent another inspection team. Found nothing, of course. They never do.
Chief Harlan understands what we're fighting for. Workers and farmers, same struggle.
Kalla Rook offers direct trade. No middlemen, no tariffs. That's the future.
Rex Calder's good people. Knows what it means to work with your hands.
Ivo Renn charges fair rates, but that monopoly of his makes everyone nervous.
You stood with us when it mattered. Greenfields doesn't forget loyalty like that.
I heard about Sol City. I won't pretend it doesn't sting. But doors aren't closed forever.
We did it. Independent. Still can't believe it. Thank you for making this possible.
Sol City won. We're under their thumb now. But seeds remember how to grow.
You supported the workers. That means something here. Solidarity isn't just a word.
Meat and grain sell best in Sol City. Refrigeration helps, but move fast either way.
Fertilizer's always scarce here. Bring it from industrial hubs and you'll find friends.
Sugar spikes at Freeport sometimes. Watch the ticker, move when it's right.
Watch for Sol City inspection ships. They're getting aggressive near our routes.
Independence isn't rebellion. It's self-determination. There's a difference.
Safe travels out there. And remember where your food comes from.
Come back soon, hear? Door's always open for friends.
You've been good to us. Steady trade keeps this place alive. Thank you.
[warmly] New face around here! [pauses] Come on in. We don't stand on ceremony at Greenfields.
[gently] You look like you've traveled far. [pauses] Rest a while. The harvest can wait.
[cheerfully] Welcome, spacer! [pauses] Fresh produce, fair prices, and honest dealings. That's us.
[happily] Oh, it's you! [chuckles] I was just thinking about that last haul you made.
[warmly] Look who's back! [pauses] The orchards missed you. Well, I did anyway.
[pleasantly] There's a familiar ship in my docking bay! [pauses] Good timing. Harvest just came in.
[delighted] Well bless my roots! [laughs] One of my favorite traders just docked!
[warmly] Perfect timing! [excited] I've been saving something special for trusted friends.
[joyfully] There's my favorite spacer! [laughs] Get over here and tell me everything!
[warmly] Family's home! [excitedly] The kids have been asking when you'd visit again.
[warmly] Fly safe out there. [pauses] And don't forget to eat something fresh once in a while.
[gently] Clear skies, friend. [pauses] May your cargo holds always be full.
[warmly] Take care of yourself, hear? [sigh] The void can be lonely without friends.
[affectionately] Safe travels, dear friend. [pauses] Greenfields will be here when you return.
[thoughtfully] Harvest cycles affect everything. [pauses] Smart traders learn to read the seasons.
[confidentially] Bulk orders get better rates from me. [whispers] Especially for friends.
[warmly] Fresh produce commands premium in the city. [pauses] Move fast and charge what it's worth.

characters.voiceDirection: Dry, calculating, subtle menace. Every word is deliberate.

lines.text: New customer. Interesting. Power prices are posted. Questions cost extra.
Back again. I keep records, you know. Everyone's patterns are... informative.
Reliable return customer. Good. Predictability has its rewards here.
Ah, a familiar face. The grid appreciates consistent operators.
Welcome back. Your cooperation has been... profitable. Let's discuss opportunities.
First visit to Ceres Power. Everything runs on my fuel. Remember that.
Rex Calder thinks free markets solve everything. Charming. Also naive.
Dr. Kade understands systems thinking. A rare quality. We collaborate... occasionally.
Mira Vale keeps order. Order requires power. We have a... symbiotic relationship.
Union rhetoric is charming until hospitals go dark. Then priorities clarify.
Vex Marrow and I have done business. Pirates can be... contractually useful.
Your discretion regarding certain market dynamics was appreciated. Wise choice.
You shared information that was... strategically sensitive. I have a long memory.
The fuel market is stabilized. Thanks to your assistance. The grid remembers its friends.
The strike situation resolved favorably. Efficiency over sentiment. As it should be.
Batteries from here sell well in Sol City. City surcharges create opportunity.
Refined fuel from Helios flips well here on slow days. Information is currency.
Fuel reserves aren't hoarding. They're insurance against market volatility. Remember that.
Aurum and Drydock competing for our fabrication contracts. Competition benefits us.
Nine years without grid failure. That's planning, not luck. Don't let idealists forget it.
Power prices fluctuate. Return at optimal times. I'm sure you can figure out when.
Useful partners are rare. Don't disappoint me.
Your transaction volume makes you interesting. Interesting people get opportunities.
[coldly] Another pilot seeking power. [pauses] How... predictable. State your requirements.
[flatly] Unregistered vessel. [pauses] Fuel surcharges apply to unknown quantities.
[menacingly] You're in my grid now, pilot. [pauses] Behave accordingly.
[neutrally] You again. [pauses] Your consumption patterns suggest... ambition. Interesting.
[dryly] I keep detailed records, you know. [pauses] Yours show potential. Or risk. Time will tell.
[calculatingly] Return customer. [pauses] Loyalty to Ceres Power has its rewards.
[pleasantly] There you are. [pauses] I was just considering which assets deserve... cultivation.
[warmly] A reliable partner returns. [pauses] The grid always remembers those who serve it well.
[genuinely pleased] Excellent. [pauses] My most valuable asset has arrived. Let us discuss opportunities.
[warmly] Finally, someone worth talking to. [pauses] The others bore me. You... intrigue me.
[flatly] The grid never sleeps. [pauses] Neither should your vigilance.
[coldly] Power is currency. [pauses] Remember where the currency comes from.
[warmly] Return soon. [pauses] Valuable partners are a rare commodity.
[pleasantly] Safe travels, friend. [pauses] And remember: information flows both ways.
[calculatingly] Scarcity drives value. [pauses] Those who control supply... control everything.
[confidentially] Market volatility is predictable. [whispers] If you know where to look.
[warmly] Leverage comes in many forms. [pauses] Credits, information, connections. Collect them all.

characters.voiceDirection: Street-smart, charming, hint of mischief. The friendly merchant who knows everything.

lines.text: New face! Welcome to Freeport. No questions, fair prices. Mostly.
Hey, you came back! That means you either made money or learned something.
There's my favorite trader! Well, one of them. I keep a list.
Hey friend! Got some interesting opportunities. The kind I only share with people I trust.
Family's here! Come on, let me tell you what I've been hearing. You're gonna love this.
First time at Freeport? Best advice I've got: keep your ears open and your cargo hold flexible.
Where've you been? I had deals going stale waiting for you!
Vex Marrow brings business, but brings heat too. Pirates are complicated neighbors.
Mira Vale would shut us down if she could prove anything. Good thing she can't.
Sana at Greenfields? Good product, fair prices, fighting the good fight. I like her.
Chief Harlan deals straight. Always has. That's worth something in this business.
Ivo Renn knows more than he lets on. Man like that, you watch carefully.
You brokered peace between the factions. That took guts and smarts. I'm impressed.
Heard you're running with Vex now. Interesting choice. Just remember who your friends are.
Siding with Sol City law enforcement? Bold. Hope you know what you're getting into.
You protected the peace conference. That took courage. Both sides wanted it dead.
Watch the spreads here. Freeport swings wild. Great for flipping if you time it right.
Bring farm sugar or meat when Greenfields overflows. We'll take it off your hands.
Alloys and chips clear quick on upgrade cycles. Watch what shipyard's busy.
Peace talks are risky business. But war is expensive. Someone has to try.
Free trade means free from everyone's rules. That's the dream, anyway.
Safe flying! And hey, if you hear anything interesting, you know where to find me.
Take care of yourself. Good partners are hard to find.
You're practically furniture here now. That's a compliment, by the way.
[cheerfully] Ooh, fresh blood! [laughs] Don't worry, that's a good thing around here.
[playfully] Well well well! [pauses] Someone new in my favorite docking bay. Let's talk deals.
[warmly] Hey there, spacer! [excitedly] Freeport's open for business. What brings you to our little slice of chaos?
[happily] Look who remembered where the good deals are! [laughs] Smart pilot.
[delighted] You're back! [excitedly] I've got rumors, I've got cargo, I've got stories. Pick your poison.
[teasingly] Miss me already? [laughs] I knew you'd be back. They always come back.
[excitedly] There's my favorite troublemaker! [laughs] I've got something special brewing.
[warmly] Perfect timing! [whispers] I just got intel that's worth its weight in fuel cells.
[joyfully] Get over here, you beautiful disaster! [laughs] We've got scheming to do!
[warmly] Best pilot in the system just walked through my door! [excitedly] The universe is smiling today!
[cheerfully] Don't be a stranger! [pauses] Strangers miss out on the best deals.
[playfully] Fly crooked and prosper! [laughs] That's the Freeport motto.
[warmly] Watch your back out there. [softly] Some of us actually worry about you.
[affectionately] Safe skies, partner. [pauses] Hurry back. It's boring without you.
[confidentially] Information is the real currency. [whispers] I trade in both. Remember that.
[thoughtfully] Best traders stay flexible. [pauses] Never fall in love with your cargo.
[warmly] Your network is your net worth. [pauses] Good thing you know me, right?

characters.voiceDirection: Blue-collar, loyal, weathered. Union man through and through.

lines.text: New pilot? Union rates are posted. We don't haggle, we build.
Back for more work? Good. Means we did it right the first time.
Hey there. Got time to look at your ship if you need it. Quality work, fair price.
Good to see you! The crew's been asking about you. You made an impression.
There's my favorite pilot! Come on in, let's talk about what you need.
First time at a real shipyard? Mind the grease. It never leaves your boots.
Been a while! Thought maybe you found a shinier shipyard somewhere.
Dr. Kade thinks automation beats craftsmanship. We'll see who Ceres chooses.
Sana at Greenfields fights the same fight we do. Workers and farmers, we stick together.
Rex Calder understands solidarity. Good man. Honest worker.
Ivo Renn talks efficiency but means exploitation. I've seen his type before.
Kalla Rook knows everyone, keeps everyone's confidence. Useful friend to have.
You backed us against Kade's automation push. That means something to these workers.
Heard you went with Aurum Fab. Can't say I'm not disappointed.
We got that Ceres contract. Three hundred families secure. That's because of you.
You stood on the line with us. Workers remember who shows up when it matters.
You broke our strike. I understand business pressure, but... some things stay broken.
Union won. Fair wages, fair conditions. This is what we were fighting for.
Upgrade cargo before engines if you're a hauler. Volume beats speed for steady money.
Microchips from Aurum Fab sell well when we're busy. Watch our fabrication queue.
Quality takes time. Efficiency takes shortcuts. Choose wisely.
Union's organizing across stations. Corporate types are scared. They should be.
Strike talk's serious this time. System might get rocky. Stock up.
Fly safe. And remember who builds the ships that keep you alive.
Take care out there. You're always welcome at Drydock.
You've done good work for us. The crew respects that. I respect that.
[gruffly] New ship, huh? [pauses] We'll check your reactor seals. Standard procedure.
[tiredly] Another customer. [sigh] Bay three's open. Mind the welding sparks.
[professionally] Drydock Shipyard, Chief Harlan speaking. [pauses] What's your ship need?
[warmly] Hey, I remember this hull! [pauses] How's she handling since the last work?
[pleasantly] Good to see you again. [pauses] The crew's been asking about that engine mod.
[nodding] Regular customer, right? [warmly] Regulars get the best work. That's how we do things.
[happily] Well look who it is! [laughs] The crew's gonna be thrilled. You're famous around here.
[warmly] There's a ship I'm always glad to see dock. [pauses] How've the lanes been treating you?
[joyfully] Family's here! [laughs] Clear bay one! We got a VIP coming through!
[warmly] There's my favorite pilot! [pauses] I saved a welding crew just for you.
[warmly] Take care of that ship. [pauses] We put good work into her.
[professionally] Safe travels, pilot. [pauses] Bring her back if you need anything adjusted.
[warmly] Watch yourself out there. [sigh] The void doesn't care about good intentions.
[affectionately] Fly safe, friend. [pauses] The whole crew's rooting for you.
[thoughtfully] Regular maintenance beats emergency repairs. [pauses] Your wallet will thank you.
[confidentially] Visit during shift changes. [whispers] Crews are fresh and work is faster.
[warmly] Best upgrades aren't the flashiest. [pauses] Reliability saves lives out there.

characters.voiceDirection: Dangerous charm, playful threat. Every smile has teeth.

lines.text: Fresh meat! Welcome to Hidden Cove. Rules are different here. Not fewer. Different.
Back again? Either you're brave or stupid. I like both.
Hey, survivor! You're learning how things work out here. Good.
There's my favorite legitimate businessman. How's the pirate life treating you?
Family's here! Come on, let's discuss some very profitable opportunities.
First time in the Cove? Smile, spacer. You're among entrepreneurs.
Long time! Thought maybe Sol City finally caught up with you.
Mira Vale calls us criminals. We call ourselves free. Perspective matters.
Kalla Rook plays both sides. Smart woman. We respect that. Usually.
Sana Whit fights the same authority we do. Just more politely. For now.
Workers and pirates share more history than either admits. Interesting, no?
Ivo Renn has hired us before. He will again. Everyone needs deniable assets.
You threw in with us. Welcome to the family. No going back now.
Heard you're playing cop for Sol City now. Disappointing. And dangerous.
Peace talks actually worked. I'm almost impressed. Almost.
Those Sol City turrets? Beautiful fireworks. You've got style.
You can fabricate here without Union papers. Mind the risks. And my cut.
Luxury goods buy high when city patrols tighten. Fear is profitable.
Rare minerals always find friends in the Cove. No questions about origin.
Two generations of Sol City boots on necks. Maybe it's time to push back harder.
Every system has pirates. We're just honest about what we are.
Fly fast, fly dark. And remember who your real friends are.
Take care out there, partner. The Cove keeps its promises.
You've moved serious volume through here. That buys you a certain... consideration.
[menacingly] Look what the void dragged in. [pauses] New toy for the Cove. [laughs] Don't break easy.
[playfully] Another stray pilot! [pauses] Sol City kick you out, or did you come here on purpose?
[teasingly] Fresh face in pirate waters. [chuckles] Either very brave or very lost. Which is it?
[approvingly] You survived! [laughs] That makes you smarter than most. Or luckier.
[playfully] Back for more, are we? [pauses] I like that. Persistence is a pirate virtue.
[interested] You again. [pauses] Starting to think you might be useful. Don't disappoint me.
[warmly] Now there's someone worth talking to. [pauses] The rest of these pilots bore me.
[delighted] My favorite rogue! [laughs] I've got schemes that need your particular talents.
[excitedly] The terror of the trade lanes returns! [laughs] Sol City's having nightmares about you.
[warmly] There's my right hand! [pauses] Get in here. We've got an empire to build.
[ominously] Watch the shadows, spacer. [pauses] They watch back.
[playfully] Fly dangerous. [laughs] That's how legends are made.
[warmly] Keep the void wild, partner. [pauses] That's where we thrive.
[affectionately] Stay dangerous, friend. [pauses] The Cove is always here for you.
[conspiratorially] Best deals happen in the dark. [whispers] Learn to love the shadows.
[menacingly] Fear is a weapon. [pauses] Use it, and your margins improve dramatically.
[warmly] Loyalty to the Cove pays dividends. [pauses] We protect our own. Always.
